member.name: M:unvell.ReoGrid.Worksheet.Copy
member.summary: Copy data and put into Clipboard.

member.name: M:unvell.ReoGrid.Worksheet.Paste
member.summary:
Copy data from Clipboard and put on grid.
Currently ReoGrid supports the following types of source from the clipboard. - Data from another ReoGrid instance - Plain/Unicode Text from any Windows Applications - Tabbed Plain/Unicode Data from Excel or similar applications
When data copied from another ReoGrid instance, and the destination range is bigger than the source, ReoGrid will try to repeat putting data to fill the destination range entirely.
Todo: Copy border and cell style from Excel.

member.name: T:unvell.Common.ActionGroup
member.summary:
Action group is used to perform several actions together during one time operation, For example there is two actions:
expend spreadsheet action
copy data action
Sometimes it is necessary to perform these two actions together, they are should undo together, in this case, create an ActionGroup and add them into the group, then invoke the 'DoAction' method of 'ActionManager' by passing this action group object.

member.name: M:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.GetParent(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the specified window's parent or owner. To retrieve a handle to a specified ancestor, use the GetAncestor function.
member.param: A handle to the window whose parent window handle is to be retrieved.
member.returns:
If the window is a child window, the return value is a handle to the parent window. If the window is a top-level window with the WS_POPUP style, the return value is a handle to the owner window. If the function fails, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call GetLastError. This function typically fails for one of the following reasons:
The window is a top-level window that is unowned or does not have the WS_POPUP style.
The owner window has WS_POPUP style.

member.name: M:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.GetAncestor(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves the handle to the ancestor of the specified window.
member.param: A handle to the window whose ancestor is to be retrieved. If this parameter is the desktop window, the function returns NULL.
The ancestor to be retrieved. This parameter can be one of the GAFlag enum.

member.name: M:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.GetWindow(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to a window that has the specified relationship (Z-Order or owner) to the specified window.
member.param: A handle to a window. The window handle retrieved is relative to this window, based on the value of the uCmd parameter.
The relationship between the specified window and the window whose handle is to be retrieved. This parameter can be one of the following values.

member.name: M:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.GetWindowPlacement(System.IntPtr,unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.WindowPlacement@)
member.summary: Retrieves the show state and the restored, minimized, and maximized positions of the specified window.
member.param: A handle to the window.

A pointer to the WINDOWPLACEMENT structure that receives the show state and position information. Before calling GetWindowPlacement, set the length member to sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT). GetWindowPlacement fails if lpwndpl-> length is not set correctly.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.GetWindowRgn(System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Region@)
member.summary: The GetWindowRgn function obtains a copy of the window region of a window. The window region of a window is set by calling the SetWindowRgn function. The window region determines the area within the window where the system permits drawing. The system does not display any portion of a window that lies outside of the window region
member.param: Handle to the window whose window region is to be obtained.
Handle to the region which will be modified to represent the window region.
member.returns: The return value specifies the type of the region that the function obtains. It can be one of the following values. NULLREGION - The region is empty. SIMPLEREGION - The region is a single rectangle. COMPLEXREGION - The region is more than one rectangle. ERROR - The specified window does not have a region, or an error occurred while attempting to return the region.

member.summary: Retrieves the current value of a specified attribute applied to a window.

member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.ShowWindowCmd.SW_SHOW
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.ShowWindowCmd.SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.ShowWindowCmd.SW_SHOWMINIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.ShowWindowCmd.SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to SW_SHOWMINIMIZED, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.ShowWindowCmd.SW_SHOWNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOW, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.ShowWindowCmd.SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOWNORMAL, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.ShowWindowCmd.SW_SHOWNORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: T:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.WindowPlacement
member.summary: Contains information about the placement of a window on the screen.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.WindowPlacement.length
member.summary: The length of the structure, in bytes. Before calling the GetWindowPlacement or SetWindowPlacement functions, set this member to sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT). GetWindowPlacement and SetWindowPlacement fail if this member is not set correctly.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.WindowPlacement.flags
member.summary: The flags that control the position of the minimized window and the method by which the window is restored. This member can be one or more of the following values. Value Meaning WPF_ASYNCWINDOWPLACEMENT 0x0004 If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request. WPF_RESTORETOMAXIMIZED 0x0002 The restored window will be maximized, regardless of whether it was maximized before it was minimized. This setting is only valid the next time the window is restored. It does not change the default restoration behavior. This flag is only valid when the SW_SHOWMINIMIZED value is specified for the showCmd member. WPF_SETMINPOSITION 0x0001 The coordinates of the minimized window may be specified. This flag must be specified if the coordinates are set in the ptMinPosition member.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.WindowPlacement.showCmd
member.summary: The current show state of the window. This member can be one of the following values.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.WindowPlacement.ptMinPosition
member.summary: The coordinates of the window's upper-left corner when the window is minimized.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.WindowPlacement.ptMaxPosition
member.summary: The coordinates of the window's upper-left corner when the window is maximized.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.WindowPlacement.rcNormalPosition
member.summary: The window's coordinates when the window is in the restored position.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.GAFlag.GA_PARENT
member.summary: Retrieves the parent window. This does not include the owner, as it does with the GetParent function.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.GAFlag.GA_ROOT
member.summary: Retrieves the root window by walking the chain of parent windows.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.GAFlag.GA_ROOTOWNER
member.summary: Retrieves the owned root window by walking the chain of parent and owner windows returned by GetParent.

member.name: T:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute
member.summary: Flags used by the DwmGetWindowAttribute and DwmSetWindowAttribute functions to specify window attributes for non-client rendering.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_NCRENDERING_ENABLED
F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_NCRENDERING_POLICY
member.summary: Use with DwmSetWindowAttribute. Sets the non-client rendering policy. The pvAttribute parameter points to a value from the DWMNCRENDERINGPOLICY enumeration.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_TRANSITIONS_FORCEDISABLED
member.summary: Use with DwmSetWindowAttribute. Enables or forcibly disables DWM transitions. The pvAttribute parameter points to a value of TRUE to disable transitions or FALSE to enable transitions.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_ALLOW_NCPAINT
member.summary: Use with DwmSetWindowAttribute. Enables content rendered in the non-client area to be visible on the frame drawn by DWM. The pvAttribute parameter points to a value of TRUE to enable content rendered in the non-client area to be visible on the frame; otherwise, it points to FALSE.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_CAPTION_BUTTON_BOUNDS
member.summary: Use with DwmGetWindowAttribute. Retrieves the bounds of the caption button area in the window-relative space. The retrieved value is of type RECT.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_NONCLIENT_RTL_LAYOUT
member.summary: Use with DwmSetWindowAttribute. Specifies whether non-client content is right-to-left (RTL) mirrored. The pvAttribute parameter points to a value of TRUE if the non-client content is right-to-left (RTL) mirrored; otherwise, it points to FALSE.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_FORCE_ICONIC_REPRESENTATION
member.summary: Use with DwmSetWindowAttribute. Forces the window to display an iconic thumbnail or peek representation (a static bitmap), even if a live or snapshot representation of the window is available. This value normally is set during a window's creation and not changed throughout the window's lifetime. Some scenarios, however, might require the value to change over time. The pvAttribute parameter points to a value of TRUE to require a iconic thumbnail or peek representation; otherwise, it points to FALSE.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_FLIP3D_POLICY
member.summary: Use with DwmSetWindowAttribute. Sets how Flip3D treats the window. The pvAttribute parameter points to a value from the DWMFLIP3DWINDOWPOLICY enumeration.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_EXTENDED_FRAME_BOUNDS
member.summary: Use with DwmGetWindowAttribute. Retrieves the extended frame bounds rectangle in screen space. The retrieved value is of type RECT.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_HAS_ICONIC_BITMAP
member.summary: Use with DwmSetWindowAttribute. The window will provide a bitmap for use by DWM as an iconic thumbnail or peek representation (a static bitmap) for the window. DWMWA_HAS_ICONIC_BITMAP can be specified with DWMWA_FORCE_ICONIC_REPRESENTATION. DWMWA_HAS_ICONIC_BITMAP normally is set during a window's creation and not changed throughout the window's lifetime. Some scenarios, however, might require the value to change over time. The pvAttribute parameter points to a value of TRUE to inform DWM that the window will provide an iconic thumbnail or peek representation; otherwise, it points to FALSE. Windows Vista and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_DISALLOW_PEEK
member.summary: Use with DwmSetWindowAttribute. Do not show peek preview for the window. The peek view shows a full-sized preview of the window when the mouse hovers over the window's thumbnail in the taskbar. If this attribute is set, hovering the mouse pointer over the window's thumbnail dismisses peek (in case another window in the group has a peek preview showing). The pvAttribute parameter points to a value of TRUE to prevent peek functionality or FALSE to allow it. Windows Vista and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_EXCLUDED_FROM_PEEK
member.summary: Use with DwmSetWindowAttribute. Prevents a window from fading to a glass sheet when peek is invoked. The pvAttribute parameter points to a value of TRUE to prevent the window from fading during another window's peek or FALSE for normal behavior. Windows Vista and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_CLOAK
member.summary: Do not use.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_CLOAKED
member.summary: Use with DwmGetWindowAttribute. If the window is cloaked, provides one of the following values explaining why: Name Value Meaning DWM_CLOAKED_APP 0x0000001 The window was cloaked by its owner application. DWM_CLOAKED_SHELL 0x0000002 The window was cloaked by the Shell. DWM_CLOAKED_INHERITED 0x0000004 The cloak value was inherited from its owner window. Windows 7 and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_FREEZE_REPRESENTATION
member.summary: Use with DwmSetWindowAttribute. Freeze the window's thumbnail image with its current visuals. Do no further live updates on the thumbnail image to match the window's contents. Windows 7 and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.DwmWindowAttribute.DWMWA_LAST
member.summary: The maximum recognized DWMWINDOWATTRIBUTE value, used for validation purposes.

member.name: T:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.OSVersionInfo
member.summary: Contains operating system version information. The information includes major and minor version numbers, a build number, a platform identifier, and descriptive text about the operating system. This structure is used with the GetVersionEx function. To obtain additional version information, use the OSVERSIONINFOEX structure with GetVersionEx instead.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.OSVersionInfo.dwOSVersionInfoSize
member.summary: The size of this data structure, in bytes. Set this member to sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO).

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.OSVersionInfo.dwMajorVersion
member.summary: The major version number of the operating system. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.OSVersionInfo.dwMinorVersion
member.summary: The minor version number of the operating system. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.OSVersionInfo.dwBuildNumber
member.summary: The build number of the operating system.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.OSVersionInfo.dwPlatformId
member.summary: The operating system platform. This member can be the following value. VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT = 2 : The operating system is Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, or Windows 2000.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.OSVersionInfo.szCSDVersion
member.summary: A null-terminated string, such as "Service Pack 3", that indicates the latest Service Pack installed on the system. If no Service Pack has been installed, the string is empty.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.Modifiers.MOD_ALT
member.summary: Either ALT key must be held down.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.Modifiers.MOD_CONTROL
member.summary: Either CTRL key must be held down.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.Modifiers.MOD_SHIFT
member.summary: Either SHIFT key must be held down.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.Modifiers.MOD_WIN
member.summary: Either WINDOWS key was held down. These keys are labeled with the Windows logo. Keyboard shortcuts that involve the WINDOWS key are reserved for use by the operating system.

member.name: F:unvell.Common.Win32Lib.Win32.Modifiers.MOD_NOREPEAT
member.summary: Changes the hotkey behavior so that the keyboard auto-repeat does not yield multiple hotkey notifications.
member.remarks: Windows Vista and Windows XP/2000: This flag is not supported.

member.name: M:unvell.ReoGrid.ReoGridControl.DoAction(unvell.ReoGrid.Worksheet,unvell.ReoGrid.Actions.BaseWorksheetAction)
member.summary:
Do specified action.
An action does the operation as well as undoes for worksheet. Actions performed by this method will be appended to action history stack in order to undo, redo and repeat.
There are built-in actions available for many base operations, such as: SetCellDataAction - set cell data SetRangeDataAction - set data into range SetRangeBorderAction - set border to specified range SetRangeStyleAction - set styles to specified range ...
It is possible to make custom action by inherting BaseWorksheetAction.
member.param: worksheet of the target container to perform specified action
action to be performed
